intro: Sida alcaeoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Sida alcaeoides is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
